greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(0) = 0; and for n >= 1, if A079559(n) = 1, then a(n) = 1 + a(A213714(n)-1), otherwise a(n) = a(A234017(n)).
comment: a(n) tells how many nonzero terms of A005187 are encountered when traversing toward the root of binary tree A233276, starting from the node containing n. This count includes both n (in case it is a term of A005187) and 1 (but not 0). See also comments in A256479 and A256991.
The 1's (seem to) occur at positions given by A000325.
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..16384
formula: Other identities and observations. For all n >= 1:
results.author: _Antti Karttunen_, Apr 15 2015
